front.title: YANG model for NETCONF Event Notifications

abstract.t: This document defines the structure of NETCONF Event Notification in a YANG model to be used in NETCONF environments. The definition of this YANG model allows the encoding of NETCONF Event Notifications in YANG compatible encodings such as JSON and CBOR.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: NETCONF Event Notifications and YANG-Push allow NETCONF servers and YANG-Push publishers to send notifications. The NETCONF client and the YANG-Push receiver decodes the message and optionally validates the header and the content before forward it to the next process. This schema validation process ensures to not break the data processing pipeline.

The structure of a NETCONF Event notification has been defined in using a XML Schema allowing NETCONF nodes to validate the header of the notification message when it is encoded in XML. However, when these notifications are sent using YANG-Push , they can be encoded in other encodings such as JSON or CBOR . In such cases, the model defined in cannot be used to validate the notification header.

This document defines the content of the header of such notifications allowing implementations to validate the notifications when they are encoded in other encodings than XML. A YANG 1.1 model is defined for such purposes.
This document updates , and specifying how a Notification header should be encoded. RESTCONF Notifications are out of scope of this document.

section.t: defines how YANG data is encoded using CBOR. These are the key relationship points between the current document and :

This document replaces this statement and ensures consistency between the different notification structures in YANG. This structure is to be used within NETCONF environments.

section.title: NETCONF Notification structure
section.t: This section defines how a NETCONF YANG Notifications are structured in XML, JSON and CBOR encodings. The same namespace "ietf-notification" is used to be compliant with .

section.title: XML Structure
section.t: The same structure as defined in Section 4 of is used. The structure uses the XML namespace that has been defined in :

Two child nodes within the "notification" container are expected, representing the event time and the notification payload. The "eventTime" node is defined within the same XML namespace as the "notification" element and is compliant with .
The name and namespace of the payload element are determined by the YANG module containing the notification statement representing the notification message.

section.title: JSON Structure
section.t: A YANG notification encoded in JSON is structured as a root "notification" container. The namespace of this container is the name of the YANG module "ietf-notification" defined in .

Two child nodes within the "ietf-notification:notification" container are expected, representing the event time and the notification payload. The "eventTime" node is defined within the same namespace as the "ietf-notification:notification" container and is compliant with .

When Notifications are implemented within RESTCONF environments, the namespace of a notification stays "ietf-restconf:notification" as defined in Section 6.4 of .

section.title: CBOR Structure
section.t: YANG data can be represented in CBOR using Names or SIDs in keys. The following sections shows how these messages are encoded in both cases.

section.title: CBOR encoded messages
section.t: Notifications encoded using keys is similar to JSON encoding as defined in Section 3.3 of . The key of the element can be the element itself or be namespace-qualified. In the latter case, the namespace of the notification container uses the YANG module name "ietf-notification" defined in .

Two child nodes within the "ietf-notification:notification" container are expected, representing the event time and the notification payload. The "eventTime" node is defined within the same namespace as the "ietf-notification:notification" container and is compliant with .

The following example shows a "push-update" notification defined in the YANG module of YANG-Push encoded in CBOR using names as keys. The example uses the CBOR diagnostic notation as defined in section 3.1 of :

section.title: CBOR encoded messages using YANG-SIDs
section.t: A Notification encoded using YANG-SIDs replaces the names of the keys of the CBOR encoded message for a 63 bit unsigned integer. This is defined in Section 3.2 of and a process for SID allocation is defined in .

Two child nodes within the root container are expected, representing the event time and the notification payload. The root container and the "eventTime" node uses a SID and the content of the "eventTime" is compliant with .
